exceptions.exn: Cannot coerce EXType to an evaluable reference.

chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof, without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

Sovle This Proof State:

Hypotheses:


Goal:
forall E E' : Ens, EQ E E' -> forall a : pi1 E, EXType (pi1 E') (fun b : pi1 E' => EQ (pi2 E a) (pi2 E' b))

Premises:
EXType : forall P : Type, (P -> Prop) -> Prop
pi2 : forall E : Ens, pi1 E -> Ens
Inductive Ens : Type := sup : forall A : Type, (A -> Ens) -> Ens Arguments sup _%type_scope _%function_scope
pi1 = fun X : Ens => Ens_rect (fun _ : Ens => Type) (fun (A : Type) (_ : A -> Ens) (_ : A -> Type) => A) X : Ens -> Type
EQ = fun X : Ens => Ens_rect (fun _ : Ens => Ens -> Prop) (fun (A : Type) (_ : A -> Ens) (eq1 : A -> Ens -> Prop) (X0 : Ens) => Ens_rect (fun _ : Ens => Prop) (fun (B : Type) (g : B -> Ens) (_ : B -> Prop) => (forall x : A, EXType B (fun y : B => eq1 x (g y))) /\ (forall y : B, EXType A (fun x : A => eq1 x (g y)))) X0) X : Ens -> Ens -> Prop
IN_Sing_EQ : forall E E' : Ens, IN E (Sing E') -> EQ E E'
Paire_IN : forall E E' A : Ens, IN A (Paire E E') -> EQ A E \/ EQ A E'
INC_EQ : forall E E' : Ens, INC E E' -> INC E' E -> EQ E E'
EQ_INC : forall E E' : Ens, EQ E E' -> INC E E'
INC_sound_right : forall E E' E'' : Ens, EQ E' E'' -> INC E E' -> INC E E''
IN_sound_right : forall E E' E'' : Ens, EQ E' E'' -> IN E E' -> IN E E''
IN_sound_left : forall E E' E'' : Ens, EQ E E' -> IN E E'' -> IN E' E''
INC_sound_left : forall E E' E'' : Ens, EQ E E' -> INC E E'' -> INC E' E''
tout_vide_est_Vide : forall E : Ens, (forall E' : Ens, IN E' E -> F) -> EQ E Vide
IN_Paire_right : forall E E' : Ens, IN E' (Paire E E')
IN_Paire_left : forall E E' : Ens, IN E (Paire E E')
INC_tran : forall E E' E'' : Ens, INC E E' -> INC E' E'' -> INC E E''
Paire = fun E E' : Ens => sup bool (fun H : bool => bool_rect (fun _ : bool => Ens) E E' H) : Ens -> Ens -> Ens
Union = fun E : Ens => Ens_rect (fun _ : Ens => Ens) (fun (A : Type) (f _ : A -> Ens) => sup (depprod A (fun x : A => pi1 (f x))) (fun X : depprod A (fun x : A => pi1 (f x)) => depprod_rect A (fun x : A => pi1 (f x)) (fun _ : depprod A (fun x : A => pi1 (f x)) => Ens) (fun (a : A) (b : pi1 (f a)) => pi2 (f a) b) X)) E : Ens -> Ens
EQ_refl : forall E : Ens, EQ E E
IN_P_Comp : forall (E A : Ens) (P : Ens -> Prop), (forall w1 w2 : Ens, P w1 -> EQ w1 w2 -> P w2) -> IN A E -> P A -> IN A (Comp E P)
INC = fun E1 E2 : Ens => forall E : Ens, IN E E1 -> IN E E2 : Ens -> Ens -> Prop
Vide_est_vide : forall E : Ens, IN E Vide -> F
INC_refl : forall E : Ens, INC E E
IN_Comp_P : forall (E A : Ens) (P : Ens -> Prop), (forall w1 w2 : Ens, P w1 -> EQ w1 w2 -> P w2) -> IN A (Comp E P) -> P A
IN_Sing : forall E : Ens, IN E (Sing E)
BinInt.Z.log2_up_le_mono : forall a b : BinNums.Z, BinInt.Z.le a b -> BinInt.Z.le (BinInt.Z.log2_up a) (BinInt.Z.log2_up b)
BinInt.Z.rem_opp_l : forall a b : BinNums.Z, b <> BinNums.Z0 -> BinInt.Z.rem (BinInt.Z.opp a) b = BinInt.Z.opp (BinInt.Z.rem a b)
IN = fun E1 E2 : Ens => match E2 with | sup A f => EXType A (fun y : A => EQ E1 (f y)) end : Ens -> Ens -> Prop
Comp_INC : forall (E : Ens) (P : Ens -> Prop), INC (Comp E P) E
EQ_tran : forall E1 E2 E3 : Ens, EQ E1 E2 -> EQ E2 E3 -> EQ E1 E3
Sing = fun E : Ens => Paire E E : Ens -> Ens
EQ_sym : forall E1 E2 : Ens, EQ E1 E2 -> EQ E2 E1
BinInt.Z.rem_add : forall a b c : BinNums.Z, c <> BinNums.Z0 -> BinInt.Z.le BinNums.Z0 (BinInt.Z.mul (BinInt.Z.add a (BinInt.Z.mul b c)) a) -> BinInt.Z.rem (BinInt.Z.add a (BinInt.Z.mul b c)) c = BinInt.Z.rem a c
EQ_Sing_EQ : forall E1 E2 : Ens, EQ (Sing E1) (Sing E2) -> EQ E1 E2
Sing_sound : forall A A' : Ens, EQ A A' -> EQ (Sing A) (Sing A')
Paire_sound_left : forall A A' B : Ens, EQ A A' -> EQ (Paire A B) (Paire A' B)
Paire_sound_right : forall A B B' : Ens, EQ B B' -> EQ (Paire A B) (Paire A B')
BinInt.Z.rem_opp_r : forall a b : BinNums.Z, b <> BinNums.Z0 -> BinInt.Z.rem a (BinInt.Z.opp b) = BinInt.Z.rem a b
BinInt.Z.pow_le_mono_r : forall a b c : BinNums.Z, BinInt.Z.lt BinNums.Z0 a -> BinInt.Z.le b c -> BinInt.Z.le (BinInt.Z.pow a b) (BinInt.Z.pow a c)
BinInt.Z.log2_up_succ_or : forall a : BinNums.Z, BinInt.Z.log2_up (BinInt.Z.succ a) = BinInt.Z.succ (BinInt.Z.log2_up a) \/ BinInt.Z.log2_up (BinInt.Z.succ a) = BinInt.Z.log2_up a
BinInt.Z.lcm_comm : forall a b : BinNums.Z, BinInt.Z.lcm a b = BinInt.Z.lcm b a
Record div_theory (R : Type) (req : R -> R -> Prop) (C : Type) (cadd cmul : C -> C -> C) (phi : C -> R) (cdiv : C -> C -> C * C) : Prop := mkdiv_th { div_eucl_th : forall a b : C, let (q, r) := cdiv a b in req (phi a) (phi (cadd (cmul b q) r)) } Arguments Ring_theory.div_theory [R]%type_scope _%function_scope [C]%type_scope (_ _ _ _)%function_scope Arguments Ring_theory.mkdiv_th [R]%type_scope _%function_scope [C]%type_scope (_ _ _ _ _)%function_scope
BinInt.Z.pow_lt_mono_r : forall a b c : BinNums.Z, BinInt.Z.lt (BinNums.Zpos BinNums.xH) a -> BinInt.Z.le BinNums.Z0 c -> BinInt.Z.lt b c -> BinInt.Z.lt (BinInt.Z.pow a b) (BinInt.Z.pow a c)
BinInt.Z.pow_le_mono_r_iff : forall a b c : BinNums.Z, BinInt.Z.lt (BinNums.Zpos BinNums.xH) a -> BinInt.Z.le BinNums.Z0 c -> BinInt.Z.le b c < -> BinInt.Z.le (BinInt.Z.pow a b) (BinInt.Z.pow a c)

```  
intros E E' H a.
unfold EQ in H.
unfold EXType.
intros b.
apply H.
Qed.
